AspectJ compiler 1.1beta4

AspectJ compiler aborts with NullPointerException when command-line arguments 
are incorrect.

For instance, I got the following error when passing an empty directory "foo" 
as the only parameter:

>ajc -classpath c:\aspectj1.1\lib\aspectjrt.jar foo
Exception thrown from AspectJ 1.1beta4

This might be logged as a bug already -- see the bug database at
  http://dev.eclipse.org (product: AspectJ, component: compiler)

Bugs for exceptions thrown have titles File:line from the top stack,
e.g., "SomeFile.java:243"

If you don't find the exception below in a bug, please add a new bug
To make the bug a priority, please include a test program
that can reproduce this exception.

This is a bug in the argument parsing code written by Mik Kersten, so I'm 
reassigning it to him.  Let me know if there's a problem with this.

I believe that Wes has fixed this bug.  If so, Mik should either assign it to 
Wes or just mark it fixed.  I can't figure out any way to reassign the bug now 
that it's not assigned to me.

Fixed in tree.  The compiler now signals an argument error when detecting an 
unflagged directory.

No test case because the harness does not support checking for abort messages or 
messages without source line numbers. It would be something like this:

   <ajc-test dir="errors" pr="30765"
   	title="error on unflagged directory">
        <compile options="protectedAccess"  
        	sourceroots=".">
        	<message kind="error" line="0"/>
        	<message kind="abort" line="0"/>
        </compile>
    </ajc-test>
